Text.Value: Mystra will cure you if we bring her the Crown of Karsus. You don't need to do this.
Do not mistake me - I want to live. But I've been careless enough with my life in the past. I can hardly stand by and watch you sacrifice yours.

EditorData.NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

Text.Value: Very well. We'll do this the old fashioned way then - swords, spells and sweat. Adventurers to the end - whatever form it may take.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determination in the face of truly formidable odds

Text.Value: No, Gale - we're not considering it. End of discussion.
An easy proposition for the Emperor to make - 'become a mind flayer' - it has no soul to sacrifice.
I know, we've been through this before. But our situation has changed since then, and not for the better.
No doubt, in the context of aeons of torture, it seems a small ask. But, of course, he does not realise what else we might have to offer.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of an eye roll - not surprised

Text.Value: The real question is, do you trust me?

EditorData.NodeContext: trust 'me' as opposed to trusting the emperor. Gale wants you to follow the path he's advising

Text.Value: Make the best decision you can - that's all anyone could ask of you. I will stand by your side regardless.
You're really serious about this?
Then I will hold my peace. But if the time comes when even her sacrifice is not enough, call on me, and I will be ready.
It's okay, Gale. Karlach wants to transform. She'll do it, for herself and for us.
I will not let you down.
He is the prince of a people who've spent aeons nursing a hatred of the very creature nestled in our skulls.
The thought must have crossed your mind? It has certainly weighed on mine.
I understand not trusting the Emperor, but Orpheus loathes illithids. If he insists we transform, it must be the only way.
Or worse, trusting a mind flayer to wield the stones, and giving it the chance to dominate a Netherbrain?

EditorData.NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

Text.Value: If it did - perhaps it would understand the weight of what it's asking of us. And why we might seek an alternative.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'what else we're capable of giving' referring to the possibility of sacrificing himself for the good of all. He's talking about what a mind flayer probably doesn't understand about humans - the capacity for self-sacrifice.

Text.Value: You might be eager to die in a blaze of glory, but I'm not. You'd kill me as well.
We should free Orpheus. Then we'll decide.

EditorData.logicalname: HAVE ORPHIC HAMMER, EMPEROR ULTIMATUM ACTIVE

Text.Value: Save him, and who's to say he wouldn't run us through at the first opportunity?
Regardless, my offer stands. Should you change your mind, I will not let you down.
In a word - yes.
Very well. If the time comes - I'll call on you to use the orb.
Entirely.
Once I'm in position, I will ensure you are removed to a safe vantage point to watch the fireworks. You need not die alongside me. Nor surrender your soul in becoming an illithid.
Barely woken from his slumber, and already the prince of the githyanki demands one of us surrender our souls in service of him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of an eye roll - not surprised

Text.Value: What about Orpheus? If we free him, he might offer another way.

EditorData.logicalname: HAVE ORPHIC HAMMER, EMPEROR ULTIMATUM ACTIVE

Text.Value: If I'm destined to die, I can think of worse ways. At least if I use the orb, I can ensure the brain dies with me.
I like the sound of that.
I could never ask you to make such a sacrifice, Gale.
I think it's time we reconsider the orb.
Absolutely not. We came this far together - we're going to survive together too.
Please - at least consider my offer.
Just because we do not like the alternative, does not mean we are not free to choose our course.
You'd truly sacrifice yourself for us?
With its power, I could put an end to this whole thing - Crown, Netherbrain, Absolute. Everything.
If you think it's best, but I hope you're confident in your powers of persuasion. The last thing we need is another enemy to contend with.
You would rather end your own life than trust the Emperor with the stones?
To cure me of the orb, yes. But what of the guilt of allowing one of my friends to sacrifice their very soul and become illithid?

EditorData.NodeContext: Persuading you of a grim but necessary course of action

Synopsis: The Emperor or Orpheus has just discussed the players options to either transform or hand over the netherstones. If Gale is willing to use his bomb, Gale will remind the player that he is willing to blow up as a possible solution. The player cannot rely on it as their only solution, but will be prompted to decide when they decide to climb up the Netherbrain.
